title: [Large-scale] Jump Performance Analysis and Ecological Training Design Based on Competitive Environments: Mathematical Modeling Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational kinesiology, understanding of data analysis concepts, and basic knowledge of linear/nonlinear equations, probability, and statistics
context.additional_context: A practical training program for sports science professionals, emphasizing the conversion of biomechanical data into mathematical models and the design of optimized training programs using optimization techniques.

learning_goals: Learners quantitatively explain the impact of performance constraints (individual, environmental, task-related) on jump performance by modeling them mathematically.
Based on ecological constraints theory, learners design training scenarios resembling actual competitions by applying probability distributions and optimization techniques.
Learners evaluate interactive elements of jump movements using multivariate systems thinking and propose improvement strategies grounded in statistical analysis.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
